intro: Conyza tricuneata, commonly known as common cudweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, with hairy stems and opposite, narrow leaves. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in clusters, and the plant produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Conyza tricuneata is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
